description: From Latin malleus (“hammer, mallet”). Doublet of maul.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) The small hammer-shaped bone of the middle ear.
examples: A fracture of the malleus handle is a rare traumatic middle ear lesion.

entries.meaning: (zoology) One of the paired calcareous structures within the mastax of rotifers.
examples: […]  in the typical mastax of a Brachionus there are two hammer-like bodies (mallei), which work on a kind of split anvil (incus);  […]  each malleus consists of an upper part or head (uncus) and a lower or handle (manubrium);
